    • Method Detail

      • createStrictRandomStructure

        public static Structure createStrictRandomStructure(java.util.Random rng,
                                    Skeleton skeleton,
                                    int n,
                                    int maxParents,
                                    int maxSlots,
                                    int maxTries,
                                    boolean createIndex)
        Generates a random structure where the structure itself is acyclic (see AcyclicityVerifier). Creation of a dependency is made by uniformly selecting a PRM class, uniformly selecting a valid child attribute, then uniformly selecting a parent directly from the class or following a recursively following a relation upon which the last step is repeated.
        Parameters:
        rng - random number generator.
        skeleton - skeleton for the structure.
        n - desired number of unique dependencies. Not guaranteed.
        maxParents - maximum allowed parent for each child.
        maxSlots - maximum length of a slot chain.
        maxTries - maximum number of attempts to generate a dependency.
        createIndex - true to create an index for each dependency.
        Returns:
        the structure.
